articles.description: England and Australia are both hoping to make history by reaching the Women's World Cup final for the first time when they meet in Sydney on Wednesday.
articles.title: England & Australia prepare for epic semi-final

articles.description: Ben Stokes' return to the England one-day side for the defence of the World Cup in India will be confirmed on Wednesday.
articles.title: Stokes to come out of ODI retirement for World Cup

articles.description: Kylie Minogue voices a special rendition of 'I Should Be So Lucky' to mark England's semi-final match against Australia at the Women's World Cup.
articles.title: BBC's England v Australia opening film feat. Kylie Minogue

articles.description: Rangers squeeze through to a Champions League play-off against PSV Eindhoven after surviving a fraught night against Servette in sweltering Geneva.
articles.title: Rangers edge past Servette to set up PSV play-off

articles.description: Chelsea agree a fee with Southampton of £53m plus £5m in add-ons for midfielder Romeo Lavia.
articles.title: Chelsea agree to sign Southampton's Lavia for £53m

articles.description: Rangers draw with Servette in Switzerland to win 3-2 on aggregate in the Champions League third qualifying round. (UK only)
articles.title: Tavernier goal earns Rangers draw with Servette to progress

articles.description: In Karen Bardsley's latest column, the former goalkeeper discusses the key battles between semi-finalists England and Australia before Wednesday's showdown.
articles.title: The key battles that could decide Australia v England

articles.description: Oval Invincibles hold their nerve to beat London Spirit by two runs amid last-ball drama in The Hundred.
articles.title: Invincibles cling on to beat Spirit in thriller

articles.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says Kevin de Bruyne could miss the next four months of the season as the club decide whether he needs surgery on a hamstring injury.
articles.title: De Bruyne to miss up to four months of season

articles.description: England captain Owen Farrell is clear to play in the World Cup after his red card in Saturday's warm-up with Wales is overturned.
articles.title: England captain Farrell's red card overturned
